Container.Name: Unraid-Kernel-Helper
Container.Overview:
With this container you can build your own customized Unraid Kernel.
By default it will create the Kernel/Firmware/Modules/Rootfilesystem with the nVidia drivers and also DVB driver (DigitalDevices, LibreElec, XBOX One USB Adapter and TBS OpenSource drivers built in).
nVidia Driver installation: If you build the container with the nVidia drivers please make sure that no other process is using the graphics card otherwise the installation will fail and no nVidia drivers will be installed.
ATTENTION: Please read the description of the variables carefully! If you started the container don't interrupt the build process, the container will automatically shut down if everything is finished. I recommend to open the log window, the build itself can take very long depending on your hardware but should be done in ~30minutes).
THIS CONTAINER WILL NOT CHANGE ANYTHING TO YOUR EXISTING INSTALLATION OR ON YOUR USB KEY/DRIVE, YOU HAVE TO MANUALLY PUT THE CREATED FILES IN THE OUTPUT FOLDER TO YOUR USB KEY/DRIVE.
UPDATE: If a new Update of Unraid is released you have to change the Repository to the corresponding build number (I will create the appropriate container as soon as possible) eg: 'ich777/unraid-kernel-helper:6.8.3' please also redownload the template from the CA App to keep the template up to date.
ATTENTION: PLEASE BACKUP YOUR EXISTING USB DRIVE FILES TO YOUR LOCAL COMPUTER IN CASE SOMETHING GOES WRONG! I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE IF YOU BREAK YOUR SERVER OR SOMETHING OTHER WITH THIS CONTAINER, THIS CONTAINER IS THERE TO HELP YOU EASILY BUILD A NEW IMAGE AND UNDERSTAND HOW THIS IS WORKING.
Forum Notice: When something isn't working with your server and you make a post on the forum always note that you use a Kernel built by this container!

Config.Name: Data Path
Config.Description: Main Path

Config.Name: Build with nVidia support
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to build the images with nVidia drivers (otherwise set to 'false').

Config.Name: Build with DVB support
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to build the images with DVB drivers (otherwise set to 'false').

Config.Name: DVB Driver Type
Config.Description: Select which type of driver you want to build into the Images/Kernel. Valid choices currently are: 'libreelec' = LibreELEC DVB drivers (default), 'digitaldevices' = DigitalDevices DVB drivers, 'xboxoneusb' = Xbox One USB DVB drivers & 'tbsos' = TBS OpenSource DVB drivers (without quotes). If you set BUILD_DVB to 'false' you can ignore this entry. (Please note that can only choose one driver)

Config.Name: Build with ZFS support
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to build the images with ZFS support (otherwise set to 'false'). ATTENTION: you have to uninstall any Plugin that enables ZFS otherwise the kernel won't work right (This custom build will load all created ZFS Pools at startup).

Config.Name: nVidia Driver Version
Config.Description: nVidia Driver Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 440.82)

Config.Name: DigitalDevices Driver Version
Config.Description: DigitalDevices Driver Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version from GitHub or enter you preferred version number eg: 0.9.37)

Config.Name: LibreELEC Driver Version
Config.Description: LibreELEC Driver Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 1.4.0)

Config.Name: Seccomp Version
Config.Description: Seccomp Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version from GitHub or enter you preferred version number eg: 2.4.3)

Config.Name: ZFS Version
Config.Description: ZFS Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 0.8.4)

Config.Name: Compile CPU Count
Config.Description: Compile CPU Count (assign as many cores of your CPU you want or set to 'all' if you want to use all).

Config.Name: Clean-up
Config.Description: Cleanup after finishing the build (set to 'full' and everything except for the output folder will be deleted, set to 'moderate' and everything except for the downloads and the output folder will be deleted, leave empty or set to 'false' to let everything as it is and don't clean up).

Config.Name: Create Backup
Config.Description: Set to 'true' if you want to create a backup of your existing bzroot, bzimage, bzmodules & bzfirmware files in the main directory of the container (Please make sure that you always backup all your files also to a local computer bevor you copy over the new files).

Config.Name: Save Log to File
Config.Description: Set to 'true' (without quotes) if you want to save the log output to a file in the main directory (every log is formated in this way: 'DATE_TIME.log')

Config.Name: Apply User Patches
Config.Description: Set to 'true' and the container will create a folder in the main directory where you can past your Kernel patch files and will apply them automatically when building the Kernel (otherwise leave blank - the container will wait 120 seconds after the start to put your user patches in the patch folder - please backup your patch files since the folder will be deleted if 'Cleanup' is set to 'moderate' or 'full').

Config.Name: Custom Build Mode
Config.Description: This is only for Advanced users! In this mode the container will stop right at the beginning and will copy over the build script and the dependencies to build the kernel modules for DVB and joydev in the main directory (I highly recommend using this mode for changing things in the build script like adding patches or other modules to build, connect to the console of the container with: 'docker exec -ti NAMEOFYOURCONTAINER /bin/bash' and then go to the /usr/src directory, also the build script is executable).

Config.Name: Build with Joydev Support
Config.Description: Set to 'true to build the images with Joydev support (otherwise set to 'false').

Config.Name: Ending Sound
Config.Description: Set to 'true' and your server will output a sound if the build process is finished (only works if you got a PC speaker installed on your motherboard)

Config.Name: UMASK
Config.Description: Container Variable: UMASK

Config.Description: Container Variable: UID

Config.Description: Container Variable: GID

Config.Name: DATA_PERM
Config.Description: Container Variable: DATA_PERM

Config.Name: Image file path
Config.Description: This is the default location where your Stock Unraid bzroot, bzimage, bzmodules & bzfirmware inside your container is located (only change if you are know what you are doing!)

Config.Name: boot Path - ReadOnly
Config.Description: boot Path - ReadOnly (needed if you enabled Backup of your bzroot, bzimage, bzmodules & bzfirmware)

Config.Name: libnvidia-container Version
Config.Description: libnvidia-container Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 1.1.1)

Config.Name: container-toolkit Version
Config.Description: container-toolkit Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 1.1.1)

Config.Name: nvidia-container-runtime Version
Config.Description: libnvidia-container Version (set to 'latest' and the container tries to get the latest version or enter you preferred version number eg: 3.2.0)

Config.Name: Beta Build
Config.Description: This option is only for beta builds and if you know what you are doing. Set this option to 'true' and the container will create a folder in the root of the directory with the version number without the beta extension in this example 'stock/6.9.0' you have to plaste the files (bzimage, bzroot, bzmodules, bzfirmware) from the beta version that you want to build into this folder (you can get it from here for example this is the link to 6.9.0-beta1: https://s3.amazonaws.com/dnld.lime-technology.com/next/unRAIDServer-6.9.0-beta1-x86_64.zip)
